cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.category: Tropical Depression (expected to reach Category 1 before U.S. landfall)
cyclone.current_location: about 60 mi (100 km) W of San Andres Island
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across Nicaragua and Honduras, forecast to enter the north-west Caribbean, cross the Yucatan, then accelerate northward across the Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Mobile Bay, on the Alabama–Mississippi coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: southeast Louisiana eastward through Mississippi and Alabama to the western Florida Panhandle, including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) likely; a brief period of minimal hurricane-force gusts can’t be ruled out near landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 3–5 ft above ground possible in and around Mobile Bay if the center makes landfall nearby.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals possible, producing flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; rough seas and dangerous rip currents impacting vessel operations well ahead of landfall.
